column1: Notre Dame says plan to stop burning coal pays for itself,http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2015/sep/21/sierra-club-notre-dames-plan-to-cut-coal-use-good-/,Notre Dame officials said Monday that a plan to phase out coal-burning power plants over the next five years will ultimately pay for itself through lower energy costs.,The Washington Times http://www.washingtontimes.com," -

,N,article,The Washingtion Times,Notre Dame says plan to stop burning coal pays for itself - Washington Times[u'Colombian President, Rebels Reach Breakthrough In Talks']",[u'http://www.huffingtonpost.com/entry/colombian-president-rebels-reach-breakthrough-in-talks_56033377e4b0fde8b0d1379e'],[u'Finally.'],NULL,NULL,[],[u'article'],[u'The Huffington Post'],"[u""The marathon session wrapped up at 5:30 a.m. just three hours before the FARC's advisers were on a commercial flight to Havana to get the commanders' blessing, according to Douglass Cassel, a University of Notre Dame law professor who was one of the government's three representatives at the talks.""]"
